children.name: Object
children.text:
Object containing the cancelled playbook executions and any skipped playbook executions that were unable to be cancelled. 
{
  "canceledPlaybookContext": [Array],
  "skippedPlaybookContext": [Array]
}

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var parentRecord = new GlideRecordUtil().getGR("interaction", "d91742531b343010a26c98a1b24bcbe0"); var cancellationReason = "Cancelling this playbook"; // demo playbook from Process Automation Experience Demo store app var scopedName = "sn_pad_demo.playbook_experience_demo"; // demo playbook experience from Process Automation Experience Demo store app var playbookExperienceId = "a56d8d93ff311010cc0853ea793bf1a6"; var cancelPlaybookReturn = sn_playbook.PlaybookExperience.cancelPlaybooksByParentRecord(parentRecord, cancellationReason, scopedName, playbookExperienceId); gs.info(JSON.stringify(cancelPlaybookReturn, null, 2));
children.text2: This shows how to cancel all executions of a specific playbook (in this case, the Playbook Experience Demo) for a given interaction record. To use this method in a UI action or business rule, pass the current object as the parentRecord instead.

children.name: parentRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
The parent record to cancel playbook executions for. The parent record can be
                any record that has playbook executions, such as an interaction record or an
                onboarding case record.

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext
children.text:
List of the cancelled playbook executions. Each playbook execution is an object in the array.

Data type: Array

"canceledPlaybookContext": [
    {
      "can_read": Boolean,
      "canceled_by": "String",
      "cancellation_reason": "String",
      "errors": [Array],
      "parent_record": "String",
      "parent_table": "String",
      "playbook_id": "String",
      "playbook_table": "String",
      "scoped_name": "String",
      "state": {Object},
      "sys_id": "String",
      "title": "String"   
    }
]

children.name: cancellationReason
children.text: String
children.text2: The reason for cancelling the playbook executions.

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.can_read
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the current user can read the playbook execution record. The current user must have read access to the parent record to be able to read the playbook execution record.

Valid values:
  • true: Current user has read access to the playbook execution record.
  • false: Current user doesn't have read access to the playbook execution record.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: scopedName
children.text: String
children.text2: Optional. The scoped name of the playbook to cancel. The scoped name is from the Process Definition [sys_pd_process_definition] table in the format scope.name. If provided, only executions of this playbook are cancelled for the given parent record. If not provided, all executions of all playbooks are cancelled for the given parent record.

children.name: playbookExperienceId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Sys_id of the playbook experience record in the Playbook Experience [sys_playbook_experience] table to use for the cancellation. Use this parameter if youâ€™ve defined custom activity state mappings. See Playbook activity state mapping.

Default: Sys_id of the Global Playbook Experience record.

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.canceled_by
children.text:
The User ID of the user who cancelled the playbook execution.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.cancellation_reason
children.text:
The cancellation reason input by the user who cancelled the playbook execution.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.errors
<Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.errors.message
children.text:
The error message.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.errors.type
children.text:
The type of error.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.parent_record
children.text:
Sys_id of the parent record that playbook executions were cancelled for.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.parent_table
children.text:
The name of the table that the parent record is from.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.playbook_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the playbook from the Process Definitions [sys_pd_process_definition] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.playbook_table
children.text:
The name of the table that the playbook is from, generally the Process Definitions [sys_pd_process_definition] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.scoped_name
children.text:
The scoped name of the playbook from the Process Definitions [sys_pd_process_definition] table in the format scope.name.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.state
children.text:
The state of the playbook execution from the Process Executions [sys_pd_context] table.

Data type: Object

"state": {    
   "displayValue": "String",    
   "value": "String"
}

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.state.displayValue
children.text:
The display value of the playbook execution state.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.state.value
children.text:
The value of the playbook execution state.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the playbook execution from the Process Executions [sys_pd_context] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.canceledPlaybookContext.title
children.text:
The label of the playbook execution from the Process Executions [sys_pd_context] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.skippedPlaybookContext
children.text:
List of the skipped playbook executions. Each playbook execution is an object in the array. For descriptions of the object properties, see the canceledPlaybookContext array.

Data type: Array

"skippedPlaybookContext": [
    {
      "can_read": Boolean,
      "canceled_by": "String",
      "cancellation_reason": "String",
      "errors": [Array],
      "parent_record": "String",
      "parent_table": "String",
      "playbook_id": "String",
      "playbook_table": "String",
      "scoped_name": "String",
      "state": {Object},
      "sys_id": "String",
      "title": "String"   
    }
]

children.name: cancelPlaybooksByParentRecord(GlideRecord parentRecord, String cancellationReason, String scopedName, String playbookExperienceId)
children.text: Cancels playbook executions for a given parent record.

children.name: parentRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
The parent record to get playbook executions for. The parent record can be any
                record that can have playbook executions, such as an interaction record or an
                onboarding case record.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var parentRecord = new GlideRecordUtil().getGR("interaction", "148776e5818d7410f87701eb89fdc824"); var playbook = sn_playbook.PlaybookExperience.getPlaybooksForParentRecord(parentRecord); gs.info(JSON.stringify(playbook, null, 2));
children.text2: This shows how to get playbook executions for a given interaction record. To use this method in a UI action or business rule, pass the current object as the parentRecord instead.

children.name: Array
children.text:
List of playbook executions for the parent record. Each playbook execution is an object in the array.
[
    {
      "can_read": Boolean,
      "canceled_by": "String",
      "cancellation_reason": "String",
      "errors": [Array],
      "parent_record": "String",
      "parent_table": "String",
      "playbook_id": "String",
      "playbook_table": "String",
      "scoped_name": "String",
      "state": {Object},
      "sys_id": "String",
      "title": "String"   
    }
]

children.name: <Array>.can_read
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the current user can read the playbook execution record. The current user must have read access to the parent record to be able to read the playbook execution record.

Valid values:
  • true: Current user has read access to the playbook execution record.
  • false: Current user doesn't have read access to the playbook execution record.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: <Array>.canceled_by
children.text:
The User ID of the user who cancelled the playbook execution. Empty if the playbook is not cancelled.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.cancellation_reason
children.text:
The cancellation reason input by the user who cancelled the playbook execution. Empty if the playbook is not cancelled.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.errors
<Array>.errors.message
children.text:
The error message.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.errors.type
children.text:
The type of error.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.parent_record
children.text:
Sys_id of the parent record.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.parent_table
children.text:
The name of the table that the parent record is from.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.playbook_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the playbook from the Process Definitions [sys_pd_process_definition] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.playbook_table
children.text:
The name of the table that the playbook is from, generally the Process Definitions [sys_pd_process_definition] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.scoped_name
children.text:
The scoped name of the playbook from the Process Definitions [sys_pd_process_definition] table in the format scope.name.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.state
children.text:
The state of the playbook execution from the Process Executions [sys_pd_context] table.

Data type: Object

"state": {    
   "displayValue": "String",    
   "value": "String"
}

children.name: <Array>.state.displayValue
children.text:
The display value of the playbook execution state.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.state.value
children.text:
The value of the playbook execution state.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the playbook execution from the Process Executions [sys_pd_context] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Array>.title
children.text:
The label of the playbook execution from the Process Executions [sys_pd_context] table.

Data type: String

children.name: getPlaybooksForParentRecord(GlideRecord parentRecord)
children.text: Gets a list of playbook executions for a given parent record.

children.name: parentRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
The parent record to check for playbook executions. The parent record can be
                any record that can have playbook executions, such as an interaction record or an
                onboarding case record.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var parentRecord = new GlideRecordUtil().getGR("interaction", "148776e5818d7410f87701eb89fdc824"); // demo playbook from Process Automation Experience Demo store app var scopedName = "sn_pad_demo.playbook_experience_demo"; var hasPlaybooks = sn_playbook.PlaybookExperience.parentRecordContainsPlaybook(parentRecord, scopedName); gs.info(hasPlaybooks);
children.text2: This shows how to check if a given interaction record has executions of a specific playbook (in this case, the Playbook Experience Demo). To use this method in a UI action or business rule, pass the current object as the parentRecord instead.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the parent record has playbook executions.

Valid values:
  • true: Parent record has playbook executions.
  • false: Parent record doesn't have playbook executions.

children.name: scopedName
children.text: String
children.text2: Optional. The scoped name of the playbook to check for. The scoped name is from the Process Definition [sys_pd_process_definition] table in the format scope.name. If provided, only executions of this playbook are checked for. If not provided, executions of all playbooks are checked for.

children.name: parentRecordContainsPlaybook(GlideRecord parentRecord, String scopedName)
children.text: Checks whether a parent record has playbook executions.

children.name: Example
children.text: var parentRecord = new GlideRecordUtil().getGR("interaction", "148776e5818d7410f87701eb89fdc824"); // demo playbook from Process Automation Experience Demo store app var scopedName = "sn_pad_demo.playbook_experience_demo"; var playbookExecution = sn_playbook.PlaybookExperience.triggerPlaybook(scopedName, parentRecord); gs.info(playbookExecution);
children.text2: This shows how to initiate a playbook for a given interaction record. To use this method in a UI action or business rule, pass the current object as the parentRecord instead.

children.name: String
children.text:
Sys_id of the playbook execution from the Process Executions [sys_pd_context]
                table that was created for the parent record. Null if a playbook execution wasn't
                successfully created.

children.name: scopedName
children.text: String
children.text2: The scoped name of the playbook to initiate. The scoped name is from the Process Definition [sys_pd_process_definition] table in the format scope.name.

children.name: parentRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
The parent record to initiate a playbook for. The parent record can be any
                record that can have playbook executions, such as an interaction record or an
                onboarding case record.

children.name: triggerPlaybook(String scopedName, GlideRecord parentRecord)
children.text: Initiates a playbook for a parent record.

name: PlaybookExperience API
text: Provides methods for handling playbook executions.
text2:
The PlaybookExperience API requires the Playbook Experience Core plugin (com.glide.playbook_experience.config) and is provided within the sn_playbook namespace.

This API requires at least one playbook in the Process Definition [sys_pd_process_definition] table. To use this API, you must have the roles required to view and cancel a running process in Process Automation Designer. For more information, see Process Automation Designer.
